byline.original: By GARDINER HARRIS and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

abstract: Pres Obama kicks off campaign to win domestic support for Iran nuclear deal with extensive question and answer session during formal news conference; suggests that many of deal's critics have not even read details of agreement; Obama has 60 days to win over skeptics ahead of Congressional vote.
lead_paragraph: “If we don’t choose wisely,” the president said, “I believe future generations will judge us harshly, for letting this moment slip away.”

headline.main: Obama Begins 60-Day Campaign to Win Over Iran Deal Skeptics at Home and Abroad
headline.print_headline: Obama Begins 60-Day Campaign to Win Over Skeptics at Home and Abroad

snippet: “If we don’t choose wisely,” the president said, “I believe future generations will judge us harshly, for letting this moment slip away.”
